Reviews.Title: “Everything we needed!”
Reviews.Author: Enr9t
Reviews.Content: Barefoot'n was great!! I went on vacation with my mom and best friend, and the two bedroom condo was perfect for us. There was plenty of room for all of us. The staff was very kind, and the warm cookies they placed out by the front desk were soooooooo good. It's pretty close to Orlando theme parks, as well as some decent franchise dining options. The only negative is that I found a couple of long strands of blonde hair on my bed, which really wasn't that big of a deal to me. I'd definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Good place for family visiting Disney World”
Reviews.Author: familytravel04_2012
Reviews.Content: Kids enjoyed having a little more room than a hotel room. We booked the one bedroom condo and really enjoyed the stay. The mattress for the sofabed needs to be upgraded so that you don't feel the coil when you're sleeping. But since the kids were light-weight and dead tired from a full day at Magic Kingdon, they slept through the night anyway. The place is convenient to restaurants and stores and about 15 minute drive from Disney World. Checkin and out were fast.

Reviews.Title: “If you miss this Hotel, you will regret it!!”
Reviews.Author: Jetson101
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here in the past and this time was as comfortable, safe and enjoyable as before. From the moment you arrive, you may be greeted by Jessica, (an absolute delight), as she is an employee who eally enjoys working with the public and she will ensure that all your needs and inquires are taken care of. We stayed in the two bedroom suite with two bathrooms, (one had an ensuite), and the large living area with adjoining breakfast bar, dining area and kitchen provided an obstucted and non crowded space. The gated grounds and secure parking helps with any concerns you may have with security and you are within walking distance to many restaurants and shopping. In addition, Old Town is close by with great food, shopping and entertainment. Disney is apprx 2.5 miles from this Hotel and has easy access. Don't forget to take advantage of complimentary morning coffee and OJ including many varieties of cereals to get you started. At the end of your day, you can enjoy some quiet time on your screened balcony with your favourite glass of wine or other beverage, or slip down to the pool, which is a little more quiet that other hotel pools. The washer/dryer and dishwasher were added features which make your stay a little more personal and private. The facilities were very clean, organized, bright and well decorated with comfortable furniture. This is the type of hotel that makes you feel like staying longer. Cheers from your Canadian Friends.

Reviews.Title: “A retreat from the crowds.”
Reviews.Author: Hannahula
Reviews.Content: My husband and I made our first trip to Disney this year with out two young sons. After a lot of research I finally decided on Barefoot'N Resort. This was a great place and we were very happy with the accommodations. I found it to be very clean and had everything we could need. The pool was nice and had very few people most times. The only reason I did not give it a 5 was because of the lack of daily housekeeping. I would highly recommend barefoot'n to anyone looking to get away from all the crowds of Disney.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit and still love it!”
Reviews.Author: Smiles53
Reviews.Content: We've stayed twice in the last 2 years. Christmas 2010 ($49 a night) & holidays in Feb. 2012 ($80 a night). Both times found our condo apts were spotless. Agree with other reviews in that we felt extremely safe there. Staff are friendly & helpful. Holiday there was great overall. Would appreciate free internet, but, considering this was the best priced condo closest to Disney, it's not a deterent & we'd readily go back if the price is good. Love Oldtown next door. Music from there can be heard until about 11 pm but with tv on never noticed it. Most times we were so tired from Disney & having fun that the music lulled us to sleep. First visit we were on the main floor and no noise from above (unlike other places we've stayed at). On Feb visit we were on the top floor & it was extremely quiet too. We like the peacefulness of the lanai and balcony. Staff & other travellers were always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: martiad77
Reviews.Content: First time at this resort and would definitely stay again. Small, but very clean. We liked the fact that it is gated and you need a code to enter. I didn't give it a 5 because you had to pay for internet service. They even had free breakfast that included cereals, oatmeal, milk, juice and coffee. Plenty of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JimCayman
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Feb 2012, 4th floor with wife and 4year old in a two bedroom, very clean, tropical feel, close to attractions, walking distance to old town, eating places all close by, you can walk to a lot of stuff, Very friendly staff. Con: Need to pay for internet access at these prices it should be free, hot tub in room fits only one.

Reviews.Title: “Great place dnt be scared to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: YoungSpadez
Reviews.Content: Great Place no housekeeping but spotless upon arrival nice staff everything close outlets, disney, and restaurants.. Very peaceful even though directly across small carnival..

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: pkomolov
Reviews.Content: It certainly is better in real life than in the pictures when booking it. Clean, modern, well-maintained. Only things I came to dislike were: 1) the amusement park which is kinda loud, but that's an annoyance only if you wanna go to bed before 11. 2) wi-fi that is available in common areas(!) only, and for 10 bucks a day. Come on, island one, the year is not 2002 anymore. One more thing: If you are gonna have any questions before or after you stay there - you will have to chase those guys. They don't reply to e-mails or voice mail, ever.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property, room, service....”
Reviews.Author: haligirl3673
Reviews.Content: We found the Barefoot'n property online and thought the property looked good for a great price. We were more than pleased with the location and property as a whole. We stayed in a one bedroom (rm 242D)in the high rise tower in April 2010 with our 9 month old and had a fantastic time. The staff was so friendly and the property was clean and well kept at all times. All of the highrise units face both the parking lot and the wetland/pool area. There was some noise from the roller coaster at Old Town but nothing that bothered us too much or kept us or our daughter awake. The property is gated and a code in needed to get into the grounds at night, it is right next to Old Town which was amusing to stroll through one afternoon but definitely not an attraction in my mind! The pool area was lovely thought the water in the kiddie pool was freezing cold so we stayed in the bigger pool for the week. They even had pool toys on site for the guests to use. My only negative was that I had called ahead and asked to reserve a pack-n-play for our daughter to sleep in but they said it was first come first serve but they had 5 so probably not going to be a problem, well we were the 6th family to need one when we checked in so unfortunately we had to go and buy one. The property is close proximity to any amenity you may need (we walked to most) and very close to the on ramp to the highway - only 5-10 minutes to Disney parks and about 20 minutes to the outlets!! Great property and price - we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: William H
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 12/24/2011-12/31/2011. Four of us stayed in a 1 bedroom with full kitchen. It had plenty of space for mom, dad, 21 year old and a 7 year old. The room was clean and had everything we needed. The staff was great. The location was the best. We have stayed in the bigger resorts and I will never go back after staying here. Old Town was right across the street, everything was right there near us. We were in very little traffic staying here. We have stayed in the larger resorts and this one by far was much better. There was not a bunch of waiting around in lines for help. When we needed something, we just walked in to the reception area and someone was there to help. Very nice pool area for adults and children. I loved it and will be going back with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, lovely ...”
Reviews.Author: EricaDawnS
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom unit for five days from November 9-14 2011. I was very impressed with the cleanliness and the entire resort actually looks better in person, as opposed to what usually happens. The rooms are a good size, kitchen very well stocked and when an item was needed, the front desk staff were helpful and brought it to us right away. The pool and hot tub are great and although it is right across from Old Town and a busy area of town, when you are by the pool in the inner courtyard you feel miles away from it all. My one complaint is that the WIFI which says is available for 7.99/day or 29.99/week was not able to be picked up in our suite. In this day in age, not having wifi access in the rooms is quite annoying. I paid for one day and walked outside and stood on the grass, and I could use it by the pool, but opted not to pay for the whole week. Old town across the street has a pub - The Blue Haven or something to that affect that offers free wifi so I just went there for a beer and used it. All in all, very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort excellent wildlife on your door step”
Reviews.Author: hazel1964
Reviews.Content: A lovely resort we stayed here from 29th sept to 14th oct 2011 in a 2 bed condo very clean ,comfortable and modern had a excellent time and would recommened very highly i will definitely return soon!! 10/10

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, just can't understand why anyone would dislike?”
Reviews.Author: Kittynibbles
Reviews.Content: Booked this as it was a great price and a good location. Being situated right next to Old Town offers the chance to walk somewhere for a change, rather than always driving. The apartment was spotless and had everything you could need; full kitchen, including washer/dryer, dishwasher, etc. All plates, pans, etc were provided too. Ability to adjust the air conditioning was an added bonus as so often this is not the case in rented accommodation in Florida. It was just my boyfriend an I that stayed and we had a one bedroom condo in the larger block, it was really comfortable for 2 people but would suggest paying extra for a 2 bedroom if there are 4 people as using the sofa bed could be a bit of a pain. There was, however a small built in cupboard in the living room with hanging space though if the sofa bed was to be used. Pool area was clean and there was even a hot tub! Great location, approx 5 mins or so to the Disney junction and the I4 which leads to everywhere else. Have been to Florida many times over the last 11 years and have to say this accommodation did not disappoint. We were there from September 9th for 2 weeks and it was not busy at all. There was some background noise (music) from Old Town at the weekends but nothing that bothered us in the slightest. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for a brand new condo unit!”
Reviews.Author: tofloridafromtherock
Reviews.Content: This deal I found on bookit and I think it couldn't be beat! Had I known how great the accomodations I would have booked here for a longer period during our vacation! The condo itself was still brand new! The flat screen TV's and in unit laundry were in perfect working order and close parking to the building. The building itself was a high-rise and gave us a view of Old Town from the front window and from the back screened in patio, a view of a wooded area. The pool was clean and never too busy! There were fresh cookies in the main bldg in the afternoons, free of course! Not to mention coffee, juice, milk and cereal in the mornings... There was a connecting door in our unit that had to have been for connecting units although I didn't question this during our visit,l have since thought about what a great ideas this would be for a large family that was travelling together!! The staff was friendly and I would definitely recommed to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: julesvacation
Reviews.Content: Selected resort using an RCI certificate. Small clean and well maintained resort with a cozy & cheerful atmosphere. Unit (deluxe 1 bedroom with living room & mini kitchen) was spacious, clean and overlooked lagoon. They serve coffee, tea, orange juice and cereal each morning. Staff is pleasant. Pool area is quiet and clean with enough chairs and tables but not a lot of shade if you’re trying to avoid the intense summer sun. Conveniently located to Disney parks and restaurants like Perkins and Marconi Grill.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint resort tucked away behind all the action”
Reviews.Author: leebee_78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort 08/09-08/16 and would highly recommend to anyone staying in the Kissimiee/Orlando area wanting to stay near the action but wants a place to relax and that is not busy or crowded. The resort is tucked off behind US 192 near Old Town. Even though we could hear the sounds from Old Town, this would not deter me recommending this resort. Old Town can run until 10-11 PM and we could hear it, but it wasn't as loud to us as stated in some of the other reviews. The bathroom fan could be run to offer white noise. I suggest taking a stroll over and browsing that area. It is run down a little but has great nostaglic stores to window shop and browse through. We went for ice cream and was not dissappointed! We arrived around 7 PM on a Tuesday night and check-in was a breeze! The girl at check in was accomedating and changed our original reservation that had us booked on the 2nd floor, but we requested to change rooms to the 6th floor and not near anyone else. The unit was clean, spacious and looked brand new. There is plenty of storage/closet space throughout the unit (there is even a pantry in the kitchen). The ceilings are high and the A/C worked perfectly. The kitchen was stocked with everyting we needed for our week stay. There is a Publix grocery store within a 5 minutes to the resort, so I suggest checking in first and come up with a grocery list. The resort will charge for housekeeping if you request it, but to be honest, I don't mind not having a daily maid service. We had plenty of towels for our family to last the week and did a load of laundry during our stay. My only negative is the pull out sofa bed is not super comfortable, so those of you with sensitive backs should sleep in the bedroom. Overall, if you are looking for a resort that is not busy and to simply relax after a day at the Disney parks, this is resort you will want to stay in. We went to the parks first thing in the AM, came back around lunch time, went for a swim, read a book around the pool, ate lunch, took a nap and then headed back to the parks at night. The resort does have recreational courts (volleyball, shuffleboard and basketball) but we did not use them. My family was looking for a place to unwind and to get away from all the crowds. After doing extensive research online for months, this was the best resort for our price range ($50-$100 per night). If you want a 5 star hotel then book it! If you just want a place that offers a full kitchen but is not busy then you should stay here. I will not stay anywhere else anymore when I visit Kissimiee!

Reviews.Title: “Average, adequate resort”
Reviews.Author: keatmon
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Barefoot'n for the second week (July 23-30) of our 16 day vacation to Orlando. We are frequent travelers to the Orlando/Kissimmee area and found Barefoot'n to be simply average when compared to places we have stayed in the past. The resort is very small, however welcoming and somewhat comfortable while still maintaining it's "Keys" atmosphere. Our unit was directly beside the reception area and 10 seconds from the pool which was incredibly convenient. Our unit was equipped with all of the necessities for our stay and if we needed something all we had to do was ask at reception. We weren't overwhelmed with this resort however it's location is ideal; just off the 192 and walking distance to Old Town, although we find Old Town to be run down and don't go there often. Since we were in the bungalow style units I can not comment on the high rise units however they are new and seem nicer and more upgraded than the bungalows. The major problem I had with the resort is that the exit gate was broken (completely removed) when we arrived and it was not repaired by the time we left 7 days later, which detracted from the "secure" feeling of the resort. The bungalow units could definitely use an upgrade and some new kitchen appliances. I was not impressed that the resort charged $7.99/day for wifi access when almost every other hotel along the 192 offered this service for free. Although the lack of wifi access was not a major issue for us, it is one of those small conveniences that is appreciated by most travelers (simply went to Starbucks for a coffee and wifi access to check in for our flights). I would say Barefoot'n is a fairly comfortable resort and would recommend it for travelers on a budget but would not recommend this resort for those looking for anything more than average or looking for anything more than a 2.5 star rating. There are some activities posted in the reception area however the resort is very limited in activities for children, etc. I can best describe Barefoot'n in the Keys at Old Town as adequate and average and with so many choices in the Orlando/Kissimmee area I would choose to say elsewhere for my next vacation to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Condo”
Reviews.Author: fabioNorthewest
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. We stayed in the high rise and it looked and smelled brand new. I felt like we were the only ones who ever stayed in the condo because of the cleanliness. It felt like our own home during the stay. The security gate and guards added to our comfort. I now feel spoiled and wouldn't stay anywhere else in the area. The washer and dryer, extra bedroom, two bathrooms, and kitchen added convenience to our stay especially with two teenagers.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: marlowres
Reviews.Content: This resort was wonderful. It is a little off the highway but totally worth it. It is directly accross the street from Old Town but the noise was not an issue. They pool area is wonderful. It is a gated community which added to its safety. The grounds are lovely and very well kept. We rented a two bedroom and there was plenty of room for all 5 of us. There was a washer and dryer in the unit which was great and the private balcony was a plus. The unit contained a full kitchen with dishwasher and all utensils. We would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: shlmstr
Reviews.Content: Check in after 4 pm. Fenced all around with traffic gate. Check in was easy. I was booked into the high-rise building, room 254D, which I assumed was on the second floor. Well -- wrong. The second number is the floor, so I was on the fifth floor; not a big deal -- there is an elevator. The room was VERY large for $90 a night -- entry way, full kitchen with refrigerator, stove, dish washer, etc. Also, clothes washer and dryer. Bathroom was very large. Reasonably sized bedroom with ceiling fan. Living room with celing fan and foldout couch (king size, I think.) Bed was solid, but pillows were not too comfortable -- over-stuffed fiberfill. Light switches were a little counterintuitive, but with a little trial and error I found which went to what. As stated in other reviews, you must pay for maid service. Also, after your stay, you are supposed to carry your trash to the outside refuse cans. All in all: very clean room, generally comfortable, good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: eam12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Barefoot'n in the Keys for 5 nights, and we loved it. Our room was spacious, clean, and very reasonably priced. The kitchen was fully equipped (it even had paper towels and a new sponge!), and having a washer and dryer right in the room made packing for this vacation so much easier! There was an awesome playground for the kids, a volley ball court, grills, and the pool was a huge hit with our entire family. Also, it was just a few minute drive from the hotel to the Disney parks. The only drawback was the noise from the fair across the street. We just turned on our bathroom fan though, and it drowned it out. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely GO BAREFOOTN'”
Reviews.Author: Musman2
Reviews.Content: GREAT PLACE! I stayed in the tower and what a nice room. It is really new. Really, really clean. Pool was great! I will stay here again and again. Anyone that writes a bad review of this place has really got me? It is gated and even the night security guy was polite and helpful. I loved the sign beside the pond. Just read it when you get there! Best value and experience!

Reviews.Title: “excellent room,terrible service equals average rating”
Reviews.Author: lindafrog
Reviews.Content: We had a two bedroom condo in the tower. Condo was beautiful, bright, clean with expensive furnishings. Well equiped kitchen. great whirlpool in bathroom. Screened in porch overlooking trees, lagoon and pool made it all a lovely place. However that is where the good stops. First of all, ASK DIRECTIONS do not trust map quest. It will take you 1202 Vine - a nonexistent address in bad part of downtown Kissimmee and the phone # does not work. We finally called to ask directions. It was difficult to get a real human to talk to. Wasted 2 hours in heavy traffic to find it. Even with address it is hard to find at night. Small unlite sign is visible from only one direction. Security gate would not open, a line of cars was forming, and someone in next car punched in code so we could get in and register. Told clerk of problems-- his excuse, if he wasn't in office or on another phone call was transferred to who knows where. This problem with gate was never corrected and maintaince had to let us out the entry gate. However the pedestrian gate is unlocked 24/7 so anyone can walk in. So much for security. The grounds are pretty and peaceful, yet trash is all over. I picked up some but there was not a trash container to be found. the staff is either very young and or barely speaks English. Perhaps that is why they showed no interest in the wrong directions. We stayed 3 nights and on the last morning 15 minutes before 10 someone pounded on our door telling us we HAD to be out by 10 or they would charge us a late check out. The way we figured it- they owed us 2 hours for the time we wasted because they gave us false address. However we were out by 10. If you are handicap with a service animal be sure to have this addressed before you enter property. They forbid any (yes it is stated as any animal) on the property. It is their policy to fine you , force you to take animal to boarding kennell and threaten to charge you 3 weeks lost rental while it is being flea bombed. .The place has the feel of the building boom gone ... what was started has beautiful classy condo development is run by Island Resort on a bare budget with minimum attention to maintaince.. Enjoy this place while it is new because we doubt it will stay nice for long. Old Town Kissimmee is right across the street and is a disappointing seedy dive. Don't bother going there. .

Reviews.Title: “Awesome condo, except for noise and location”
Reviews.Author: cantbelieveit_9
Reviews.Content: My family found our 1 bedroom unit to be very clean and nicely appointed. All the staff we encountered were really great. As we checked into our room a little early, we found Hector (I believe that's his name) the maintenance man thoroughly checking the room and making sure everything was OK. This would be our new hotel to stay at in Orlando if it was in a different location. Unfortunately, we didn't take seriously the warning about noise from the other reviews. If you stay in the tower section, the noise from Old Towne is really bad, esp. on the weekends. Then every morning at 5am a housekeeping cart rattled very loudly past our first floor unit and woke me up then. Napping during the day was out because I could easily hear any people talking outside our unit. Little sleep makes for a grumpy Mom at the amusement parks. Noise and smells from other units could easily be lessened if the connecting and outside doors were well insulated. There was about a 1/4" gap under our door to the outside, which would easily allow noise and bugs into the unit. Thankfully we saw no bugs. We asked to change our unit, but the property was booked solid. Also, there are some hotels in the area that look like they might be temporary housing for some families down on their luck. We never really felt unsafe though. Bad location, but awesome staff and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience, clean with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Travellor2011-02
Reviews.Content: I just returned from this resort with my spouse and two other family members. the rooms were spotless, we loved the layout of the two bedroom unit. The location is great if you choose to visit any of the Disney attractions, or other theme parks in and around Orlando. If you want to shop it is also close to the Premium Outlets Mall, lots of choices for restaurants. The staff was super friendly, pool was clean, with a seperate section which is fenced off for younger children. We would definitely return to this resort if visiting Orlando again and would highly recommend it to friends and family. Just one point to add, this resort is right across the road from Old Town which has a roller coaster and many other activities, so on the weekend nights you could hear the noise if your bedroom faces that side of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Low class all around”
Reviews.Author: Jenesto
Reviews.Content: A typical RCI Resort choice. Horrible location, walmart crowd, smelly rooms, bugs in room, in a poor part of town. The whole thing made my skin crawl. We checked in and immediately walked in the room and it smelled gross. From the room, I called our Hilton Vacation Club and booked a stay at our home base and left. Here is the best part. Five minutes after I checked in, I walked back to the front desk and said to the girl that I'm checking out. She said 'ok'. I replied " you realize I checked in five minutes ago, right". She said " yes". Nothing else was said. She did not even ask why I was leaving or if she could help. That should sum it up right there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but not a very good value.”
Reviews.Author: cableguy7035
Reviews.Content: nice rooms, great location, but as a hotel a ripoff. Room was filty when we checked in 25 to 45 dollars a day for maid service 75 cents for any phone call a each for soap, 8 dollars a day for internet, I was suprised they didn't charge for parking. There are alot of better value's all over the place. They never did clean our room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: havardzoo
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this property to family and friends. We stayed in the new highrise unit 232-C and could not have been happier. The unit was VERY clean and was equipped with everything we needed. The washer and dryer were a bonus, we were able to go home with clean clothes.The location was great, close to everything. The units were roomy and loved the screened in porches. We will for sure be staying here on our next Florida vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Affordable & Looking Forward to returning.........”
Reviews.Author: napkat
Reviews.Content: This place was beyond incredible!!! The pictures did no justice, because it looked even better in person. Staff was very nice and friendly although we had very little contact with them. The resort is located near all 3 theme parks (Disney, Sea World & Universal Studios) ... I know this because we visited all three.. Barefootn Resort is located near everything, you have a variety of restaurants, it is located behind old town which has several carnival rides and activities for the entire family. It is also looking near anything and everything you could imagine including groceries stores, outlet malls and placing that sells discounted theme park tickets!!!! This was a terrific getaway trip for myself, my husband and our 3 y/o son. My family recommendations are extremely high and would recommend you enjoy the same stay as we did at Barefootn' Resort in Kissimmee, FL.

Reviews.Title: “even better than I expected!!”
Reviews.Author: laura9574
Reviews.Content: We were so suprised at the quality of the room for the price we paid. I have stayed in the Kissimmee area multiple times and never heard of this place, but I will be going back, probably MANY times! The room was beautiful and spacious and the full kitchen was so well equipped. We were happy to have our own personal screened in balcony. The beds were very comfortable and bathrooms were huge! My boyfriend and I traveled with 4 other adults and there was plenty of foom for us all! We even saw some baby deer grazing as we sat on our balcony! We loved how centrally located the place was and that it was gated. I have NEVER been so happy. There is nothing negative I could say.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: Floridabusybee
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here for a week while visiting the Disney water parks and a few other places during our week getaway. We actually ended up at Barefoot after leaving another resort we had booked online that I refused to stay at upon arrival. My sister had stayed at Barefoot recently and said it was very nice. They had availability and were able to accommodate us in a 2 bed/2 bath unit. Wow, is the best word to describe the units! This is a new property and the rooms still have that clean, new construction smell. The place is beautiful. We felt like we were at home. The kitchen is fully stocked with all the essentials. There are flat screen TV's in both bedrooms and one in the living room. Super quiet washer and dryer. The lighting in the master bathroom was not good, but no biggie. Nice decor and color choices. There is no fitness center. Continental breakfast was hot cereal packets and coffee, but who needs continental breakfast with such a nice kitchen! We were facing the Fun Spot park and yes you can here the people from time to time, but the rooms are so like home, we had no problem sleeping each night. Also there is a security gate at the property and you must have a code to get in. Great stay!

Reviews.Title: “I love this place very cozy.”
Reviews.Author: lala031
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean and a home away from home. Location was behind old town you can walk and not have to sit in the traffic. Excellent place my next trip I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Haven in the heart of Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: Mousemad
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay once again at Barefoot'n in the Keys. This is a Timeshare Resort which we own on. We bought through RCI due to its location as we absolutely love Oldtown & its great being able to walk there for a drink of an evening or to look around the shops & get something to eat. My husband likes it here as he is usually the driver so he can also have a drink!! Since our last visit the resort has been given a coat of paint & new furnishings as they have built a brand new block of condos & have spruced up the original condos. Very comfy beds & the units are very well equipped with everything you could need. Nice pool area & grounds with plenty of wildlife, racoons, a snake, a deer family & the resident stray cat which was still there this visit, much to my daughters delight, you wouldnt think you were in the middle of Kissimmee. We didnt find it noisy at all, but then we were out at the Bike nights/car nights, but on the other nights it was fine. Staff are very helpful & friendly & there is good security as it is gated & there is a security guard patrolling the grounds at night. Parking can be a bit of a nightmare sometimes, but not bad enough to put us off staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: nacsuper
Reviews.Content: I have been going to Orlando all my life and I can't believe I have just found out about this place. My mom and son were in one room while my husband and I were in another and we still had a huge livingroom area to enjoy. We had a wonderful big kitchen and we were able to go to the nearby Publix to pick up shrimp and lobster to cook. We could see the playgrouind and the awesome pool from our patio. I will always stay here going forward.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, clean, well kept, good location, 15 minutes to Disney...”
Reviews.Author: Debulah6295
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 nights in a 2 bedroom condo with 3 little kids. The condo is well kept, nicely decorated, very clean, and the kids loved the pool. There are charcoal grills near the pool, a play ground, basketball court, and volley ball net. Old town is across the street and we enjoyed a walk through one afternoon without the nightly crowds. My only complains is noise. Our first night there was a Wednesday and the rides at Old Town were busy. In the front bedroom we could hear the people screaming on the rides. Also, we could hear kids running and jumping around in the condo above us each night. Fortunately, each night by 11:00, the "family of elephants" above us, quieted down. You can also hear water running if someone above you flushes the toilet. I would stay there again since the noise wasn't enough to keep me up. I would have called the front desk and complained if it had. It is very resonably priced as well.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort we've ever stayed in...WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: Steel574
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 3 night stay and we could not have asked for a better experience.The location is excellent, convenient to all the attractions and shops.The staff was very friendly and helpful. The resort was more than we imagined it would be. My husband and I stayed at a 1 bedroom condo in the luxury high rise with our 2 children.It was quite spacious.Everything looked new and very clean .The kitchen was fully equipped with all and anything you could possibly need. The living/dining area were comfortable to relax for a meal or watch TV. The bedroom had it's own flat screen TV , my kids stayed in the bedroom and loved it.My husband and I used the pull out sofa,it was great.The wide balcony overlooks the pool and play area,very nice. It is a gated resort so you get your own entrance code which gives you that sense of safety.Old town is right next door.By the way, just like many people I was a bit concerned at first as you never know what type of experience you will have. I have to say,I am so happy that we stayed here.I am from Tampa but we love the kissimmee/ Orlando area and this was the best resort we've ever stayed in. We were here for a short stay but will definitely come back again soon.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RESORT!”
Reviews.Author: Anette77
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Disneys, Sea World etc. this is the perfect place to stay. VERY clean apartment with everything you need (kitchen supplies, dishwasher, washer, dryer) in a safe, gated area. Great family friendly pool and a cozy lake with alligators around it (don’t worry – there is a fence around it!)! The resort is close to everything you need in Orlando; the great parks and the many places to dine in Kissimmee. We arrived at 2 am. (!) and were met by a very friendly employee who helped us out. This is really good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “ORLANDO'S BEST KEPT SECRET!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jasmineleno
Reviews.Content: WOW, where do i begin, I stayed in a one bedroom with my boyfriend for two nights! wish I could have stayed longer. I absolutely loved the location, decor and amenities. Everything was new, perfect for the two of us and the kitchen was so convienent since i love to cook. Publix was right down the street so I cooked a big dinner. Pool was quiet, we mostly had it to ourselves.I also loved the pull out couch, it really came i handy for our movie night. The washer/dryer worked great after our long day at the water park. I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS TO ANY ONE LOOKING FOR A ROMANTIC GETAWAY. DEFINETLY MY HOME AWAY FROM HOME. ANYONE KINDA SKEPTICAL...I WAS TOO... DON'T BE, ITS SAFE (YOU CAN'T ENTER UNLESS YOU HVE A PASSWORD TO THE GATE)AND IN MY OPINION, ORLANDO'S BEST KEPT SECRET. BOOK IT! BOOK IT! BOOK IT! (HOPE MY REVIEW WAS OF SOME HELP)

Reviews.Title: “We are glad that we decided to stay at this beautiful resort!”
Reviews.Author: FutureLawyer2015
Reviews.Content: This resort was so nice, clean and well maintained. We stayed in the high rise which is the newer part for non-timeshare owners. We were in a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit and it was so nice. Both bedrooms had enough closet space and flat screens mounted on the wall. The master bedroom had only a shower but the other bathroom which is just outside the 2nd bedroom, had a nice size tub/shower combo. The living room area was a very nice size and there was even a screened in patio area right off the living room. The pool/hot tub area was very nice however, while we were there it was too cold to go swimming. The only difference staying here then at a hotel (besides being in a cramped hotel room) is that you have to take your trash to the dumpster located on property, take the sheets off the beds and put them all in a pile, and load the dishwasher and start it. Also, there is no daily maid service unless you ask for it and there is a fee for it. This is a beautiful resort and I will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean Place”
Reviews.Author: TNation
Reviews.Content: We went to Orlando for an extended weekend and stayed at barefoot'n in the keys. We were in the new highrise, I was told it only opened last June. The place was very clean and fully stocked with towels, soaps and kitchenware. The only complaint I have is the internet fee being $7.99 per day. Other hotels and even McDonalds give free internet. I asked and I was told that the new building does not have internet in it yet. Would have made since to prewire for that when it was being built.

Reviews.Title: “Great little place”
Reviews.Author: SANDRABNIreland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 weeks through RCI and enjoyed it thoroughly. The condo seemed to have been upgraded recently and everything looked well. Lovely pool. Free breakfast, though we didn't go. Near lots of restaurant and The Old Town with its amusements, car and bike nights and shops. Security at night and gated. The only complaint I have is the price and quality of the internet. $30/£20 for a week seems rather a lot and we could only get the internet near our bedroom window. Other people couldn't receive it at all in their rooms. I understand they are working on it so things should improve. Recommended and not much more expensive than the lower-grade hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Luv2Vaca7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon from the end of Dec 2009 to the beginning of Jan 2010. We had a fantastic time and we were amazed at how spacious the 1 bedroom suite was! All of our family and friends couldn't believe the price we paid for this room since we don't own a timeshare and it is a timeshare resort. We got such a great deal! The bed was super comfy, the bathroom was very big, the kitchen came with everything that we needed, the living room was great, and the balcony was huge! We encountered the housekeepers on a couple of occasions and they were also wonderful to talk to just as the staff in the lobby was. The only complaint I have is the noise. Since our room was an adjoining room we could here the kids next door but luckily they were only there for the first 2 nights of our stay. We could also here the people above us walking around. If the noise was better it would've been an A+ resort but I would still give it an A. It is also very close to Old Town with lots of fun rides and stores. The noise level from Old Town was very low and most of the time we couldn't hear anything! We walked over there to spend New Years and we had a blast. Lots of fun bars and live music for the younger group in Old Town. All in all, our honeymoon was amazing and the resort we chose made a BIG difference! Can't wait to stay here in the future when we have kids!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place!”
Reviews.Author: PoopsScotland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 28 nights in June/July 2009. We loved the whole stay from beginning to end. Staff were very helpful, and friendly, nothing was ever too much trouble. We were located in the new block, and were the first to stay in the apartment. Had full size kitchen, also laundry facilities, balcony, large fridge, infact all that you needed for a stay, especially a long one like we had. Located just to the side of the Old Town, but very quiet, even at the weekend when the Old Town is busy. It is gated, so we felt safe. There is a security guard at night too. Ideal location to get to and from disney, also ideal to hit the I4, restaurants located nearby, and also supermarkets not far away. Have stayed in Kissimmee and I drive area before, but this was such a nice experience, would go there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely WONDERFUL!!”
Reviews.Author: Holly922
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfect! My husband and I went with two other adult friends and had a blast! It is located near most everything in Orlando. The staff was very polite and helped you with everything you needed. It is located right across the street from Old Town, but the noise at night was not loud at all. We stayed in the newer building with the two bedroom. It was so very nice! The 2 bedroom has 2 baths, a full kitchen plus a pull out sofa bed if needed. You have a nice screened in balcony and spa tub! The kitchen comes equipped with most everything you need to cook, but you might want to buy paper plates or bring your own because the ones they provided are not very big. The pool was great, very relaxing! There was not one thing about this hotel that we did not like, we have not complaints. Although I would not recommend the chinese restuarant that is in Old Town...it was not good at all. I WOULD recommend Pacinos Italian Grill restuarant that is across the street from Old Town, that restuarant was great! The hotel had a continential breakfast, but it only consist of three types of cereal, orange juice, milk or oatmeal. It was fine for us, we are not big breakfast people. We definetly plan on coming back in a few years when our kids are old enough for Disney. Also, the hotel is gated and you get a passcode to enter at the gate...so the security was nice. In the two bedroom you have a big LCD tv in the living room area and also one in each bedroom, that was a plus. We have no complaints about this hotel at all!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing !!!”
Reviews.Author: langc
Reviews.Content: First time away in 5 years without kids.... two adult friends were with us. Enviorment was perfect. Staff was friendly. Pool and hot tub were clean and amazing. Nice comfortable rooms..A smaller timeshare very quiet and relaxing.... Locared behind old town...

Reviews.Title: “NICE OFF SITE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: svteacher
Reviews.Content: We stayed from June 28-July 2, 2009 in the new high-rise. The room was BRAND NEW and had everything a family of 3-4 would need. The hotel is only about 3-5 MILES from DISNEY; easy driving. The location was peaceful, secure, and not over crowded.

Reviews.Title: “If you like lizards, this is the place for you”
Reviews.Author: jmitch51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort and found it mostly ok, except for the lizards and stray cats. Every step that I would take outside in the grass, three or four lizards would dart out from under my feet. In addition, we had a lizard in our room that I had to chase down with a broom and WDW popcorn bucket. Thankfully that was on the last night, or my wife would have insisted that we found other accommodations. We will stay at the Disney budget hotels from this point forward. Not an ideal experience to say the least. In addition, there were stray cats everywhere, no doubt to feast on the lizards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: amickeyfan
Reviews.Content: Was a little afraid since I read some of the latest reviews here. I have to say, I had a totally different experience than they did. I felt very safe here. There were gates up on all sides of the complex. The complex is small to where the staff knows you and they know who belongs there and who doesn't. I stayed in a 1b with a partial kitchen. We were given a hot plate with a frying pan, sauce pan and extra cooking utenciles. There was service for 4 already in the kitchen area. The pull out sofa is a queen size bed, very comfy for my 16 year old. With the bed pulled out, there was a lot of room to walk around in the room (unlike many other places I have stayed). The bathroom was very spacious & loved the whirlpool tub! The vanity area was very large with lots of under the counter storage area. The bathroom itself was very large for a 1 bedroom unit. I liked the convience of the w/d in the unit. The bedroom had a very comfy (and looked new) king size bed. The room was a good size. There was plenty of room for storage. The only thing that I was not crazy about was the hot water heater. The unit we had was 107B. It was an upstairs unit and when ever the people downstairs would use the hot water, the heater would make heat up and was on the noisy side. Other than that. I really enjoyed my stay. I liked the cereal in the morning in their lobby, as well as the fresh coffee all day long. My daughter loved the cookies in the afternoon. We did not have to pay for the internet since they have 2 computers in the lobby that you are allowed to use for FREE. You can use them for 20 minutes, longer is no one is waiting to use them after you. My daughter did her school report on them. The staff there are super! They are more friendly than you get at an expesive Disney resort..and you see the same people everyday. You get to know them. I would go back there in a heart beat! I really had a nice stay there and would recommend it to anyone. I left my camera at home, but wished I had it with me for pictures... this is one place to stay if you want convience, yet peacefulness with a friendly staff in the heart of the theme parks!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place but some problems”
Reviews.Author: Marco
Reviews.Content: We were there in the first week of January 2009. It is a timeshare that has less than ten years of age but it seems a lot older. It is a nice clean place but lacks some elements that make me wonder if I want to go back. For example, they have carpet floor in the living room and in the bedroom instead of tiles. They have old key locks with regular keys instead of magnetic cards. The A/C is noisy. The kitchen has only two chairs so even if the unit can accommodate four people, you won’t be able to eat at the same time. The bedroom is kind of small and the storage is limited. But the worse is the linens and beach towels that are really worn-out. THEY MUST RENEW THEIR STOCK because it is not acceptable. Do what we did and ask for new linens and towels if necessary. One the plus side, the full kitchen is well equipped (big fridge, big oven, toaster, blender, etc...) and there is a continental breakfast every morning with cereals, oatmeal, juice, milk and coffee. (Continental breakfast from 8h15 to 9h30, so you will probably miss it if you want to go to Disney parks early). On some days you will find cookies in the lobby in the afternoon. The pool is great and there is a smaller pool with fountains for the kids. We also had some unfortunate encountered... We found a couple of silverfish... Eurk... But I guess it is hard to avoid in that region when you are on the first floor. I just hope that they will find a way to get rid of those. The “Old Town Carnival” is just in front of the Barefoot so it is nice to take a walk there at night. Take the time to go to the “Magic Store”, you can buy all kind of magic stuff and the guy will show you some amazing demonstration. All over I would give this resort a 5/10 and I would probably try something else next time I am in Kissimmee. Unless I could have a unit in the brand new building that is currently under construction.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: babymama2km
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fun week at Disney World. We booked this condo thru RCI. The price was good, but it was an example of 'you get what you pay for.' We had the 1BR condo with full kitchen and pull-out couch for our family of 4. First the good points: It was very close to the south entry gate of Disney (within 5 minutes). The condo complex was cute from the outside and had a security gate. The heated pool and hot tub were clean and nicely maintained. There was a children's pool with sprayers (not heated) too and sand volleyball court. The staff was very nice too and our kids loved the baked cookies in the afternoon. On the downside: The condo was cramped compared with others we've stayed in, with little storage space for luggage and all the accumulated Disney junk. We were also on the ground level and could hear every step from the guest upstairs (footsteps woke us most mornings). The hot water tended to run out after 2 or 3 showers in the morning (particularly if the family upstairs was also showering). The decor was uninspired, the bedding like a cheap motel's, and the overall cleanliness questionable. The bathroom, in particular seemed a bit dirty and I found the exposed toilet brush and plunger (next to the toilet) gross. While the proximity to Disney was awesome, I would say the Old Town area is a little seedy -- kind of like a carnival. The motels nearby also looked a little creepy. Overall: I'd recommend that any visitors who simply want a decent and affordable place to crash while visiting The Mouse, may want to try this property for the affordability, nice pool and kind staff. But, I'd recommend staying in a second floor unit (with kitchenette) to ease the noise issues (plus the bathrooms upstairs were much nicer!).

Reviews.Title: “never again!!!”
Reviews.Author: sonnee
Reviews.Content: we booked this stay through our vacation plan. it was represented as a 4/5 star resort. our reservation confirmation stated "full kitchen". when i confirmed it 24hrs in advance(as instructed), i was told it's a "partial kitchen". it consisted of a mini-fridge, which didn't freeze, two shelves that could't hold anything more than a saucer -high dish, bottom space for one bottle. a 1 or 2 cup coffeemaker(which was replaced) & a mini-microwave. the bathroom sink leaked all over the floor, it was reported on sunday am, we were told it couldn't be fixed till tuesday & were given extra towels to absorb the water. the heating/air conditioner didn't work, or the thermostat or both. the table had two chairs, but not enough room to fit two plates if you planned on cooking in the microwave. the front gate also advertised "nightly rentals". there was also a daily charge for internet service in the office. this was not a place we would have stayed at for the price when motels all around us offered the same amenities for 1/4 the price & no charge for internet service in the room. on the positive side, the staff was very friendly & helpful with some of the issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: mfitm
Reviews.Content: It was in a great location, very close to Disney World. Down Town Disney is only 5 minutes away. We stayed in a one bedroom floor level. There were 4 of us. My sons stayed on the sofa sleeper and were comfortable. Everything was nice and clean. The heated pool was very nice and never crowded; it could have been cleaner though. The only draw back we had is that you don't get replacement towels and rags; you must clean them yourself. We were there Sat. - Sat. and 4 towels and rags were not enough so I had to do the laundry a few times. They only give enough detergent for one load. You can purchase more if needed. There are many restaurants near by. I recommend the breakfast buffet across the street; very affordable and delicious.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time, going back!”
Reviews.Author: parker163
Reviews.Content: We only got to stay 4 days here, but we had an amazing time. Great place to go if you want something in the middle of everything but still feels secluded (was a gated resort, locked). The pool/hot tub area was amazing....warm water. Was never crowded. We were out pretty much all day, and the pool officialy closed at 10...but they as long as we were quiet, they let us swim until 12am. Everyone was super nice and put out amazing cookies, fresh baked, every day around coffee time. Was in walking distance to a really fun mini-golf place and of course, Old Town, which stays busy until almost 2 am(don't worry about the noise, we couldn't hear any!)....we aren't the bar crowd, but still enjoyed walking around there every night, fun shops, fun rides, and a great old car parade on sat. night (i think they have one friday nights too, but we didn't make it). Really close to all the attractions and everything was easy to find. There are washer and dryer units in your unit which is great to throw your wet suits/towels in. Be aware, they offer maid service (new towels, sheets, and cleaning) but for $50 for each time....and they gave us 2 rolls of toilet paper and if you need more, they are $1 a roll. Our suggestion is to bring wipes with you or to go to the Publix groc store across and street to buy some. The only other problem, was that there were 4 of us staying in the 1 brdroom unit, so two had to sleep on the pull out sofa, which was comfortable. But they only supplied a sheet and one light blanket...I know it's FL, and warm, but I would suggest bringing a top blanket...we asked for one and they brought one up to us right away. Our pillows were also pretty pathetic...so would suggest asking for more or bringing your own. My husband and I can't wait to go back, and this is probably the only place we would stay at in the Disney area.....we loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “A great little place to stay”
Reviews.Author: csmab
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two weeks and really enjoyed it. Very nice condo with a partial kitchen - toaster, coffee machine, fridge and microwave - ok for us as I wasn't cooking but if you want to cook then I recommend a condo with a full kitchen. Nice big bathroom, bedroom and living area. Surprisingly quiet and we felt safe even though it's in a built-up area beside Old Town. We generally ate out at night-time in one of the local restaurants (Logan's Roadhouse or the Ponderosa being our favourites), then had a walk round the Old Town and Fun Spot amusements. Barefoot'n is in a great location with easy access to the main roads and attractions. Nice pool area and friendly staff. Internet access available in reception for $6 per day or $30 for the week. Plus DVD hire and free breakfasts (though we didn't try these). There didn't seem to be organised activites for children etc but we never look for these anyway. Would we go back! Yes! Very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “We're goin' back”
Reviews.Author: corvettenutCarlisle
Reviews.Content: Friendly, quiet, great for Old Town access. Close to Disney down 192. Clean, comfortable beds, included continental breakfast. Have had a 1 bed/1 bath THREE times, plenty of kitchen equipment etc. Nice pool tho' no organised activities [two of or visits were timeshare exchanges] Currently adding extension tho' it was still quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: miliowa
Reviews.Content: Barefoot'n is a small condo/resort for the Orlando area. Not more than 30 units total - if that. We had a one bedroom. It was smaller than most condos we have been at. It was well kept and a quiet property. Easy to get to from Disney and all the major attractions. Behind some nasty looking hotels, but had no problems. Small pool area, but with so few units no need for a big one. The bathroom was clean, but no counter by the sink to put stuff on. The gate provides a false sense of security since the code to use it is a no brainer and probably not often changed. A little out dated and small - depending on what you are paying it can still be a better value than an over priced hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: Mousemad
Reviews.Content: We bought a timeshare for Barefoot'n in the Keys as it was converted to RCI points and we already owned through RCI. Decided to stay here for our holiday in May this year and so glad we did. Absolutely loved this place, accommodation was excellent with everything you could possibly need and very clean, Pool area great and never crowded, Staff very friendly and helpful (free cold brekkie every day, plus cookies , hot drinks etc... all day). Location is fantastic, right next door to Old town and its many shops, restaurants, bars and attractions. Brilliant for going for a meal and a drink and no-one had to drive. Everything near at hand and the cruise nights were fab if you like classic cars and bikes!! Gated entry and security were very reassuring too. Would definately stay here again and its not far from Disney. Overall - Brilliant holiday in a brilliant resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location! But Rooms Need Updating”
Reviews.Author: Azulsapphire
Reviews.Content: Close to WDW... located just behind Old Town on Rt 192. Nice heated pool with a view of the lake. Front Office Staff was not overly friendly or helpful. My second story one bedroom unit was a little run down and needed an update. The furniture was old and worn out. The decor was not very attractive or inviting. The bedroom did have a large hot tub, which was very nice. The resort was just so-so and not likely to visit again.

HotelInfo.Name: Barefoot'n in the Keys
HotelInfo.Address: 2750 Florida Plaza Boulevard, Kissimmee, FL 34746
